description: Barbados issued a warning against spreading false information on social media about the Government’s workplace policy in respect of Covid-19. Spreading false information about Government policies is prohibited under the Computer Misuse Act.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Barbados's Queen Elizabeth Hospital is restricting visiting hours. The new interim visiting hours across all general and surgical wards are 12:00 noon to 1:00 p.m. and 5:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily. Visits to the hospital’s Intensive Care Units – Medical Intensive Care Unit, Surgical Intensive Care Unit, Paediatric Intensive Care Unit, and Neonatal Intensive Care Unit – will be facilitated between 11:00 and 11:30 a.m.; 4:00 and 4:30 p.m.; and 5:30 and 6:00 p.m. Patients are only allowed 2 visitors at the time and visits cannot be longe than 2 hours. All visitors will be required to go through temperature tests at entrance.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Barbados enacts the Emergency Management (COVID-19) Curfew Directive, 2020. Under the Order, a curfew is in effect from Saturday, March 28, until Tuesday, April 14, while all businesses, except essential services and those identified, were ordered close as Government seeks to contain the spread of COVID-19. The curfew is between 8 pm and 6 am. Attorney General Dale Marshall announced that there will be a fine of $50,000, or one year in prison, or both, for anyone found guilty of breaking the curfew.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: The original curfew was from 8 pm until 6 am. Now it is a full on 24-hours curfew beginning on April 3rd, 8 pm. UPDATE: From April 3rd, 2020 the curfew is going to be 24-hour

description: Barbadians will remain under curfew until midnight May 3, 2020, but new measures are in place for them to get essential goods. UPDATE: The original curfew was extended to April 5. Now it has been extended to May 3, 2020

description: Prime Minister Mia Amor Mottley has announced that Government will be putting measures in place to facilitate fruit and vegetable vendors during the curfew period, which has been extended until May 3.
Members of the public are advised that from tomorrow, Tuesday, April 14, essential cargo deliveries will be done through an appointment system at the Bridgetown Port, between 7:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m.

Barbados enacts the Emergency Management (COVID-19) Curfew Directive, 2020. Under the Order, a curfew is in effect from Saturday, March 28, until Tuesday, April 14, while all businesses, except essential services and those identified, were ordered close as Government seeks to contain the spread of COVID-19. The curfew is between 8 pm and 6 am. then, the curfew was 24-hours. Now, the 24-hour curfew is also extended to May 4th. UPDATE: Barbados’ Prime Minister Mia Mottley announced that the curfew that was supposed to end on April 14th, will be extended to May 4th.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Barbados declares that it is currently in Stage 1 after the island recorded the first cases of COVID-19 on March 17th. Activation of National Emergency Operations Centre and Isolation Centre. Preparation of severe treatment facility and Paragon, St. Lucy District Hospital or Field Medical Hospital for screening, quarantine and isolation. Reconfiguring of polyclinics to facilitate local screening. Advice on limiting mass gathering to reduce risk for local spread. Suspension Of Visits & Closure Of Public Health Institutions.

the Parliament of Barbados, by a majority Resolution and in fact, by unanimous support in the House of Assembly, agreed to extend the State of Emergency in Barbados until the 30th of June. UPDATE: the Parliament of Barbados, by a majority Resolution and in fact, by unanimous support in the House of Assembly, agreed to extend the State of Emergency in Barbados until the 30th of June.

With immediate effect, all arriving passengers who have been in Iran, or Lombardy, Emilia-Romagna or Veneto in Italy in the previous 14 days will be required to report to Port Health at the points of entry.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Bolstered screening capacity. Assistance from the Barbados Defence Force from their medical personnel to join with port health in order to give more numbers at ports of entry, particularly at the airport

description: Minister of Health and Wellness, Lt. Col. Jeffrey Bostic, has announced that there will be an escalation in the numbers of people being tested for COVID-19 “in short order”.

description: Barbados: The Environmental Health Department, in the Ministry of Health and Wellness, has developed a framework geared towards ensuring the safe management of food service establishments during the COVID-19 crisis. This is designed to work in conjunction with the domestic health regulations,Health Services Act Cap 44, and the purpose is to increase the safety in the light of COVID-19 crisis. Under this new framework, all food service establishments are required to clean and sanitize their premises before and after work hours and food service workers are required to wear masks and sanitize after each food delivery.

Barbados recommends contractors to consider staggered work hours for their employees in accordance with the COVID-19 Framework for the Recommencement of the Construction Industry. Workers should go home right after the work to avoid crowing in public transport and observe social distancing while using toilets. Contractors should sanitize surfaces and provide their employees with separate towels, closed bins and a separate water.
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: In accordance with the country's Health Services Act Cap 44, all food delivery workers are required to pass health report at the beginning of the shift. Temperature test upon entering the workplace. They are also required to follow social distance in case if they need to communicate with other employees, they must be provided medical masks and discard the disposal ones after 4 hours of wear/or wash reusable ones after each shift. They need wash their hands after each food delivery, sanitize all surfaces and all utensils must be sealed.

In accordance with the country's Health Services Act Cap 44, all food delivery workers are required to pass health report at the beginning of the shift. Temperature test upon entering the workplace. They are also required to follow social distance in case if they need to communicate with other employees, they must be provided medical masks and discard the disposal ones after 4 hours of wear/or wash reusable ones after each shift. They need wash their hands after each food delivery, sanitize all surfaces and all utensils must be sealed.

As a part of Phase 3 (May 18-31) of re-opening the country, new protocol for hairdressing salons is established in The Health Services Act CAP.44 (Hairdressers) Regulations 1970 and further enhanced in the light of COVID-19 crisis. New protocol has provisions on: face shields on service providers and customers, cleaning & sanitizing work stations and restrooms, making appointments with clients, social distancing in salons, as well as more detailed instructions on cleaning/discarding shampoo and pedicure bowls after each client.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Barbados: Director General, Human Resource, Ministry of Public Service, Gail Atkins, made a presentation on "Safe Work; Safe Environment; Safe People", during the Learning and Development Directorate’s Webinar, where she announced that there was a protocol on cleaning public service areas. Ministry of Public Service wants to review workplace hygiene standards as some public officers will be returning to work. This protocol utilized recommendations from World Health Organization and the Ministry of Health and Wellness.
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: MoH of Barbados met in press conference to discuss readiness to respond and prepped meetings with local hospitals, Ministry of Tourism, Ministry of Maritime Affairs, and Blue Economy. Have protocols they are prepared to mobilize from past Ebola and SARS outbreaks
MoH of Barbados advises against non-essential travel to Hubei Province in China
Prime Minister Mia Amor Mottley has called on Barbadians 70 years and over and those with health challenges to self-quarantine as much as possible for the next 12 weeks.

Senior citizens aged 70 and over and members of the disabled community are reminded that there are two specially designated days for them to go shopping at the supermarkets, hardware stores and fish markets, irrespective of their surnames.

On March 23rd, Barbados announced penalties for persons who have been ordered to self-quarantine in their homes but fail to do so. Failure to comply may result in the offender being placed in mandatory quarantine at a health facility. Disobeying can also result in a maximum fine of $5000.00, or imprisonment of up to 12 months or both.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Barbados's Minister of  Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Commerce, Dwight Sutherland, announced that businesses which should not be operating during this time under the COVID-19 restrictions may face disciplinary action for failing to adhere. He mentioned that Attorney General will "enforce" the closure of businesses through the Emergency Management Act legislation.

description: The Barbados National Standards Institution (BNSI) is implementing a "Safe Business Certification Mark" to make sure that the workplaces, the small businesses, put the necessary health and  safety regulations in place that  persons can feel comfortable with returning  to work. Micro, Small and Medium business will be receive "Occupational Health and Safety" certification by the Ministry of Commerce. This new standard was aligned with the ISO 45001 Occupational Health and Safety Standard, which is the World Standard for Occupational Health and Safety.

description: Barbados is limiting public access to the Community Legal Services Commission suite of offices at the Supreme Court Complex. Members of the public who wish to inquire about, or apply for legal aid services, are asked to first make initial contact with the department by calling 535-9900. A decision will then be made as to whether the caller should attend at the office in person, or be interviewed via telephone.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government

description: The Barbados Postal Service has advised that the Post Office will not be accepting mail for international destinations, as this service will be temporarily suspended. Incoming international mail will still be processed. Local mail services will continue to operate.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government

description: The Royal Barbados Police Force (RBPF) is closing police station tours for groups and schools.

Barbados introduces new shopping schedules during the country's 24-hr curfew. Persons whose surnames begin with A and B, are to shop on Mondays between 8-11 AM and Fridays between 1-4 PM. Their Banking day is Monday between 9AM and 1PM. Persons whose surnames begin with C, D, E & F - shopping on Wed between 8-11 AM and Sat 1-4 PM. Banking day for them is Wednesday between 9AM - 1PM. Persons whose surnames begin with G, H, I, J & K - shopping on Thursday between 8-11AM and Monday 1-4PM. Banking day for them is Thursday between 9AM - 1PM. Persons whose surnames begin with L, M, N, O, P, Q, R - shop on Friday 8-11AM and on Tuesday 1-4PM. Banking day for them is Friday from 9AM to 1PM. Persons with surnames from S-Z: shop on Saturday 8-11 AM and Wednesday 1-4PM; while banking day for them is Wednesday 9AM til 1PM. Senior citizens shop on Tuesdays and Sundays from 8 - 11AM and their banking day is Tuesday between 9AM and 1PM. Essential/healthcare workers to shop on Thursday 1-4PM and Sundays 11AM - 2PM and use banks on Thursday 1-4PM. All persons must carry their IDs at all times because they will have to show it before entering the premises. People are also advised to wear masks and carry umbrellas/water in case of long lines.
Barbados restricts public visits to Her Majesty’s Prisons Dodds.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: All employees of businesses not deemed essential services are asked to work from home over the curfew period Saturday, March 28, to Tuesday, April 14.

The Central Bank of Barbados and the Financial Services Commission (FSC) advise that all deposit-taking institutions and/or businesses facilitating domestic or international payments can open under the extended 24-hour curfew, which runs from April 15, 2020 until May 3.

To further isolate vulnerable patients and staff from potential exposure to the Coronavirus (COVID-19), the Queen Elizabeth Hospital has established a Clinical Decision Unit (CDU) at Jemmotts Lane, St. Michael.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
